title: Tear gas fired as inmates clash in Matara Prison
byline: (UPDATED) Sri Lanka Police says that the clash between two groups of inmates in the Matara Prison is still continuing with tear gas fired to control the situation.

title: Dan Priyasad succumbs to gunshot wounds
byline: The convenor of the “Nawa Sinhale National Movement” and political activist, Dan Priyasad, has succumbed to his injuries after being hospitalized following a shooting incident in Wellampitiya last night (22).

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur in most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m. today (23).

title: Gunmen open fire on tourists in Himalayan region, killing at least 26 people
byline: At least 26 people have been killed and a dozen injured in a suspected terror attack in the disputed Himalayan region of Jammu and Kashmir, authorities said Tuesday.

title: ‘You have a right to know what happens to your tax money’ – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the taxes paid by the people should have value and that the public has a right to know how those funds are being used.

title: Unrest at Matara Prison brought under control
byline: Sri Lanka Police says that the unrest which erupted at the Matara Prison has now been brought under control.

title: 2025 LG Polls: ‘E-Service’ launched to assist postal voters
byline: The Election Commission says that an ‘e-service’ has been made available to assist postal voters in locating their designated voting location and certifying officer.

title: Heavy traffic at Borella due to fallen tree; 7 vehicles damaged
byline: A tree has fallen near the Cemetery Roundabout in Borella, damaging seven vehicles and causing severe traffic congestion, police reported.

title: Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith leaves for the Vatican
byline: The Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith, departed for the Vatican this morning (23).

title: Special announcement for ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ attendees
byline: Sri Lanka Police have issued a special notice to devotees participating in the ongoing ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ exposition at the Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy.

title: Flash flood hits Chilaw
byline: A flash flood situation has occurred in Chilaw city, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Sri Lanka’s economy shows remarkable recovery in 2024, says World Bank
byline: Sri Lanka’s economy has made a remarkable recovery in 2024, surpassing growth expectations by recording 5 percent growth, compared to the projected 4.4 percent, says the World Bank.

title: All inmates of Matara Prison being transferred to nearby prisons
byline: All inmates of the Matara Prison are currently being transferred to nearby prisons, according to the Prisons Department Spokesman.

title: Indian HC meets ex-Presidents Mahinda and Ranil
byline: The Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka, Santosh Jha, has called on former Presidents Mahinda Rajapaksa and Ranil Wickremesinghe in separate meetings.

title: Three arrested over Dan Priyasad’s murder
byline: Three suspects have been arrested in connection with the murder of the convenor of the “Nawa Sinhale National Movement” and political activist, Dan Priyasad.
